thread.title: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un’s playboy brother 'assassinated with poisoned needles by two women at Malaysia airport’
thread.title_full: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un’s playboy brother 'assassinated with poisoned needles by two women at Malaysia airport’ - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un’s playboy brother 'assassinated with poisoned needles by two women at Malaysia airport’
text:
North Korean leader Kim Jong-un’s playboy brother 'assassinated with poisoned needles by two women at Malaysia airport’ Kim Jong Nam was reportedly assassinated at Kuala Lumpur International Airport by two women believed to be North Korean operatives who were still at large Share Comments By Patrick Lion 12:14, 14 FEB 2017 Updated 12:32, 14 FEB 2017 News Kim Jong-Nam, the eldest son of North Korean leader Kim Jong-Il, has reportedly been killed in Malaysia using poison (Photo: AFP) Share Comments Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email The estranged half-brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong-Un has reportedly been poisoned by two women at an airport in Malaysia.
Kim Jong Nam, the older half brother of the North Korean leader, was known to be based mostly outside of his home country.
Kim was poisoned at Kuala Lumpur International Airport by two women believed to be North Korean operatives, who were at large, according to South Korea's TV Chosun, a cable television network, that cited multiple South Korean government sources.
It has been reported they used "poisoned needles".
North Korean leader Kim Jong-Un has lost his half-brother after he died after reportedly being poisoned at an airport in Malaysia (Photo: Getty) Kim Jong-Nam at Beijing airport in 2007 (Photo: AFP) Read More Kim Jong-un claims North Korea has launched missile capable of carrying nuclear warhead Police in Malaysia said an unidentified North Korean man had died en route to hospital from Kuala Lumpur airport on Monday.
Abdul Aziz Ali, police chief for the Sepang district, said the man's identity had not been verified.
An employee in the emergency ward of Putrajaya hospital said a deceased Korean there was born in 1970 and surnamed Kim.
Kim Jong-Nam at Narita airport near Tokyo in 2001 (Photo: AFP) Kim Jong-Nam at Narita airport near Tokyo in 2001 (Photo: Reuters) Kim Jong-Nam at Narita airport near Tokyo in 2001 (Photo: Reuters) Read More North Korea 'will self destruct unless it stops testing long-range ballistic missiles' The South Korean government source who spoke to Reuters did not immediately provide further details.
South Korea's foreign ministry said it could not confirm the reports, and the country's intelligence agency could not immediately be reached for comment.
In 2001, Kim Jong Nam was caught at an airport in Japan traveling on a fake passport, saying he had wanted visit Tokyo Disneyland.
Kim Jong Nam in Macau in 2010 (Photo: AFP) Like us on Facebook Follow us on Twitter Daily Newsletter Follow @DailyMirror Subscribe to our Daily newsletter Enter email Subscribe Comments Show more comments More On Reuters AG Kim Jong Nam Kim Jong-un North Korea Hospitals Theme parks
